TopicTitle: What do you miss about the old forum?

Articles.Content: What do you miss about the old forum? I'm asking this as I try to adapt to the new forum look.

Which old forum? I miss being able to say what I liked in a post while liking a post, but that was like 2 years ago now.

I don't know what the new forum is missing, as I've been on mobile since the changeover.

So I guess so far all I miss is a keyboard
I miss how people had, however reluctantly, accepted its flaws and moved on to talk about space and video games.
Now I cant tell where the new messages start

The old forum was the one before the 2015(6?) host change.

The update a few hours ago is just a reskin, I know change is hard to live with but you'll survive as all of us will...

Edited September 1, 2017 by Gaarst
Looks......interesting.

Comparison of the old forum and the new forum:

I preferred the old one; it was waaay easier on the eyes.

- More blue

- Less boundary boxes

- Simpler likes (also true with Facebook)

Probably I'd get over the boundary after a while, and the likes thing isn't hard to refine further, but I really like the old bluish theme. I get it though that some people do like using white themes, so I propose adding a colour theme changer.

Edited September 1, 2017 by YNM

THE BLUE!

I mean, going from the really old forum (lots of blue, some grey) to the medium forum (a little blue, scorching white) was hard enough, but in the new forum it's basically all bright white.

Can we get a dark theme, please? As an option?

Nothing? This one is approx 99% the same?

 

 

7 hours ago, RoadRunnerAerospace said:

Now I cant tell where the new messages start

Yeah you can, that function has not changed.

I don't miss a thing about the forum prior to this one. It was a pug ugly mashup of glaringly obnoxious whitespace and poor layout that also managed to mangle a significant number of my posts by a) splurging control characters all over them and b) breaking internal links. For a forum ostensibly aimed at mobile users it offered a distinctly sub-standard mobile experience and I personally found it lacking in many ways compared to the previous forum.

Happily the latest update is a just a re-skin (so far as I know) and hasn't re-mangled my posts. Quite how it's contrived to be even uglier than the last one boggles my mind however. Did someone fire a bunch of paint-soaked Nerf darts at a screen and plonk down a UI element over each mark or something?

Apart from imgur albums, apparently.

I miss basic HTML support...

IPS (the current forum software) is highly customizable as far as themes... Heck, theres even many "ready-made" themes that are much better than the blaring white default theme, that are cheap...like $20-$30...

But for whatever reason, Squad obviously doesnt want to spend the man-hours to have someone in-house make a custom theme, or to "buy" a ready-made theme.

As to functionality, there is some customization/settings that can be tweaked by Squad, but much of what we are seeing is just default IPS settings themes... So not much use in getting really heated and repetitively complaining about things...

All that can really be done is to try to convince Squad to put in the $$ for customization...If they wont, they wont... And they have had IPS for a couple years now, so if they havent yet, its not likely things will change. Especially with everyone rehashing, complaining and picking everything apart...

I do almost all my forum reading on my laptop. Some on my desktop. None on mobile. I'm probably in the minority. I'm also older (61). The new update still seems to be getting tweaked but it is very bright and the fonts seem to be different or smaller. It is pretty hard for me to read. What I just did was boost the zoom from 100% to 125%. This is a major improvement in increasing readability while decreasing the massive white space. Unless the background gets changed, viewing most pics will still require going to the imgur album. The white background is blinding against the black of space. I guess that is no different than before. I'll adjust but with a few simple tweaks on Squads end things could be a lot easier.
